reviews.review: This latest update is disgusting. I played over 1k hours and it suddenly felt like it's just as dreadful as reading Shakespeare's play in oldass English.
this is being typed because it won't let me say why i would recommend it

This game was fun but with every patch the game gets more broken. The developers announce features and then release a public test beta. They ignore all feedback, they don't care if things are broken. The excuse is always they want to test in live and get a larger base of feedback. This leads to them releasing broken patches every single patch and then fixing some issues and leaving a large amount of patches. They generally fix bugs more then a year later unless it's a major bug. They've recently broken the UI, broken player models, broken hit boxes, broken killers, broken perks. All of these things were complained about before the recent PTB, during the PTB and now in live. The developers only care about the money, not the player base. That's why they leave bugs in and push DLC constantly.

Save yourself some money and buy a different game.

The Devs keep pushing out buggier and buggier patches, with this most recent one taking the cake. Desync problems make the game just about unplayable as Survivor, not to mention the glaring bugs with certain maps. It feels completely untested, and there's no news on any upcoming patch to fix it.

With the way that they're releasing broken patches, not to mention not listening to community feedback, Behaviour isn't worth supporting, and this game is not worth it in its current state.

Not much to be said. BHVR refuses to listen to the community, and the latest update has completely made the game unenjoyable. Getting hit when it's nowhere near you, constantly getting DC'd out of lobbies, queue times taking forever, and just overall lack of bug fixes or patches has ruined the experience.

It sucks because I absolutely love this game and still want to play it all the time, but I get beyond frustrated actually loading into the game now. I hope they fix things so I can enjoy one of my favorite games again, and adjust this rating.

[h1]Introdu√ß√£o[/h1]

Dead By Daylight √© um jogo no estilo survivor horror que nos tr√°s uma proposta bem interessante. √â simples, existem duas classes para os jogadores: os sobreviventes, e os assassinos. O objetivo dos sobreviventes √© reparar 5 geradores de energia espalhados pelo mapa para assim poderem abrir a sa√≠da e escaparem vivos, enquanto o objetivos do assassino √© impedir a conclus√£o dos geradores e matar todos os 4 sobreviventes vivos na partida.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

A jogabilidade de Dead By Daylight parece ser ‚ÄúEz‚Äù para o assassino numa primeira impress√£o, isso se n√£o houvesse barricadas e janelas que formam um sistema chamado de ‚Äúloop‚Äù para assim atrasar o assassino e concluir os geradores. Enquanto cada assassino possui uma habilidade √∫nica e distinta para ganhar vantagem sobre o sobrevivente e quebrar o seu ‚Äúloop‚Äù fazendo-o cair no ch√£o mais r√°pido e coloc√°-lo em um gancho (se um sobrevivente for enganchado tr√™s vezes, ele √© morto e eliminado do jogo) para que voc√™, o assassino, possa ir logo atr√°s de sua pr√≥xima v√≠tima. Existe tamb√©m as chamadas ‚Äúperks‚Äù, que te possibilitam ganhar vantagem sobre seu oponente, em diversas situa√ß√µes de jogo, tanto para sobrevivente, como para assassino, podem jogar at√© com quatro perks que possibilitam um leque de estrat√©gias e jogadas para se ganhar a partida. Sem falar nos itens usados pelos sobreviventes que os ajudam em sua gameplay, sendo eles:

- Kit M√©dico: Ajuda o sobrevivente a se curar sozinho, e a curar mais r√°pido seus colegas de equipe.
- Caixa de Ferramentas: Ajuda a quebrar os ganchos preservando a vida dos seus colegas, e tamb√©m reparar geradores mais r√°pido.
- Lanterna: Cega o assassino, permitindo o sobrevivente tomar dist√¢ncia e se esconder do assassino, e tamb√©m liberta outro sobrevivente do ombro do assassino caso ele seja cegado enquanto estiver levando o sobrevivente ao gancho.
- Chave: Abre a escotilha, uma rota de fuga alternativa caso n√£o seja poss√≠vel reparar os 5 geradores.

[h1]Gr√°ficos[/h1]

Por se tratar de uma empresa pequena e independente, os gr√°ficos de Dead By Daylight n√£o s√£o l√° uma obra de arte, mas s√£o aceit√°veis e vem sendo melhorados conforme o tempo desde seu lan√ßamento. O game j√° est√° no seu quinto anivers√°rio, e se for comparado atualmente com suas primeiras vers√µes, o game j√° evoluiu muito com o passar do tempo.

[h1]Comunidade[/h1]

Infelizmente o jogo possui uma comunidade t√≥xica, que n√£o parece melhorar e √© mimada pela Behaviour (desenvolvedora do game). Vale ressaltar que al√©m de um g√™nero survivor horror, o game necessita de estrat√©gia por conta de seus elementos de gameplay. Por√©m a comunidade chorona adora ficar mandando na gameplay de outros jogadores como: ‚ÄúN√£o pode tunelar!‚Äù, ‚ÄúN√£o pode campar!‚Äù, ou at√© mesmo: ‚ÄúN√£o pode gen rush!‚Äù, ‚ÄúN√£o pode usar comunica√ß√£o por voz!‚Äù (Tunelar: focar em um sobrevivente para elimin√°-lo o mais r√°pido poss√≠vel do jogo. Campar: ficar perto do gancho para que evitar o salvamento do sobrevivente. Gen rush: terminar os geradores o mais r√°pido poss√≠vel). E outra causa que fortalece esse ‚Äúchoro‚Äù por parte da comunidade √© a pr√≥pria desenvolvedora, que adora desbalancear seu jogo, buffando a classe sobrevivente, deixando a gameplay muito dif√≠cil para a classe assassino, tudo a fim de sugar o m√°ximo de dinheiro dos players, sem se preocupar com a sa√∫de do jogo.

[h1]Considera√ß√µes Finais[/h1]

A premissa de Dead By Daylight √© sim, muito boa, por√©m a execu√ß√£o j√° n√£o d√° pra dizer o mesmo. Dependendo do seu gosto, voc√™ poder√° enjoar f√°cil do game, como tamb√©m poder√° jogar por horas e horas. Voc√™ vai sim, passar raiva com certas situa√ß√µes dentro do jogo (tunnel, camping, gen rush, comunica√ß√£o), vai ser xingado por jogadores t√≥xicos, vai perder partidas por conta do desbalanceamento e vai sofrer de bugs que podem atrapalhar sua gameplay. Como tamb√©m voc√™ poder√° se divertir com seus amigos, provavelmente vai rir de jogadas mal feitas dos seus (ou seu) oponentes, e ir√° aprender cada vez mais sobre o game conforme for jogando. A cada 3 meses √© lan√ßado novos personagens com novas perks e skins (sim, voc√™ pode customizar seu sobrevivente, ou assassino), o que volta o jogo a se tornar relevante e atrai novos jogadores e tamb√©m jogadores antigos que tinham parado por algum motivo.

By: Kassius

No entanto, as atualiza√ß√µes recentes, trouxeram muitos problemas que n√£o agradam aos jogadores, como HUD com informa√ß√µes espalhadas e hitbox desonesta, onde o killer pode te acertar, mesmo se voc√™ j√° estiver longe do alcance dele. 
Ent√£o, devido a essas quest√µes e os desenvolvedores claramente n√£o se movimentarem para resolver esses problemas, o jogo se tornou cansativo.

Before reading this, I am splitting this up into two parts. Broken desync hit-boxes (which of right now was and still is in since 4.5.1) will probably consist until 4.5.2 at minimum, at most it won't be fixed until we complain again. If you want basically up to date news on BHVR's bullshit then I suggest popping in and checking Scott Jund's channel. Check out his content as well as he's genuinely a hilarious guy.

-- If you are playing on patch 4.5.x (from 0 to whenever they fix Desync) --
There are a lot of things you will need to understand about what's been going on. Survivors are having Desync issues where the killer is a couple of feet behind where they actually are. BHVR has heard us as of writing this but previously they didn't listen to what people said about the PTB or didn't have enough time to revert it. They need to learn to take their time on updates and actually listen to their community. They also need to stop putting in things that NOBODY wanted or asked for. Don't get me wrong, the new UI was a little bit of eye-candy but it's all-over the place and generally isn't good for a competitive scene/feel. I get REALLY competitive in this game and I want to keep improving but now 'n days, it seems impossible. I play both Survivor and Killer, both with their fair share of issues. Right now, the main problems are Survivors getting Desync and (I have no idea if they boosted the chance of this but) survivors plundering a key by chance without any luck increasing perks/offerings. If you are planning to get this game then search up what BHVR has done and make sure the Desync issue is fixed. If you don't then you will regret getting this game. I would say they are prioritizing the next update to fix Desync issues but last few things I saw from their twitter was an slightly updated UI and a profanity filter on post-game chat which really doesn't matter at all.

P.S. BHVR can't revert to a previous build because they don't keep them. They should keep the previous build of very build they make just in case this happens again. (Or better yet, BHVR needs a hard-drive or a database to keeping old builds in so they can revert stuff) No builds means everything is final and that's disorganized as fuck.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-- If you are playing when Desync is fixed --
Congratulations... If you are a vet. player reading this in which case... great job on surviving this shit-storm. Otherwise, I wish you the best of luck playing this game. You are probably going to have to try to suck up as much BP as possible to catch up (I would suggest trying to get Doctor with Barbecue and Chilli, Distressing and maybe two other perks as soon as possible) and be prepared for the game to take a turn for the worst every single time BHVR updates the game. BHVR may have fixed possibly by far the WORST update in DBD history (as of writing this) but they probably are going to find some way of fucking it up so hard, they will make it even worse.

If you aren't up for being stressed out then I would suggest playing literally anything else. At the start, you will feel discouraged, the community will treat you like garbage and it's really gonna suck but once you get enough to get anywhere in the game (which to be honest, I still don't really even know when that is other than maybe just unlocking all teachables) then you might have a little bit of fun playing this. If you don't have a lot of time on your hands though then it's better to play something else like Civilization. (DBD meme. lol)
-----------------------------------------------

In short, this game had a LOT of promise and even got Pyramid-Head in the game but the BHVR team (as of writing this) is lazy as fuck and put minimal effort into DBD. If you are still insistent on buying this game then I wish you the best of luck and welcome to hell. Watch some Otzdarva to get started as he is VERY educational about this game.

Sorry this was quite long but I am genuinely pissed off at BHVR and this stupid game right now and I just want to warn everyone of the dangers of getting into this game. This game is buggy, dysfunctional and unbalanced as all hell.

jogo muito mal polido vao ajeitar essa merda quando

okay so I reviewed this game after about 300 hours and recommended it. I was aware of the issues it had but they didn't really affect me and I still had a lot of fun playing this game. But the more hours I played, the more these things become unavoidable.

The core game design is flawed in that the most effective strategy for both sides is really boring. For survivor: hold m1 on gens for as much of the match as possible, play really safe in chases, use god loops, predrop pallets. For killer: focus on killing off one survivor as early as possible and secure a 3v1, camp, don't engage in chases that will be difficult.

The most effective strategies of both killer and survivor is to show your skill as little as possible. So basically a tryhard 3k hour player plays very similar to a 50 hour player that has no clue what the're doing. Incredible game design, super interactive /s

You can't even be mad at a killer facecamping you when there's literally no incentive to go anywhere else on the map, and in fact you'd be actively disadvantaging yourself if you did. Just camp a hook in a 3-gen 4head. What the fuck are they gonna do? Choke themselves by doing all the other gens?

And what's even worse is that killers aren't even objectively strong. The same thing happens on the survivor side. You can play a game of DBD where both sides feel like they've lost and that the game is unfair for them. Again, incredible game design.
Devia ter jogado esse game antes... muito divertido para se jogar com amigos e desafiante jogando solo ;) issae hehe
Realmente o jogo est√° quebrado e cheio de bug, √© um √≥timo jogo porem eles n√£o tem uma no√ß√£o de quanto √© frustante jogar um jogo cheio de bugs

EDIT: BHVR has changed the garbage can update that nobody asked for. They Reverted the new survivor animations so it's back to normal which is perfect. They updated the HUD so it is no longer awful and everywhere on the screen AND they made it so you could increase or decrease the size of the skill check HUD which is amazing. I am leaving my previous review up but I am back to being happy with this game.


It pains me to write this review because DbD is one of my favorite games of all time. But this recent update where BHVR update the UI, and new player animations is just awful. The new map changes are pretty good but that's the only good part and it isn't enough to salvage the BS that is going on. The UI is god awful, why is it even remotely close to where you SHOULD be looking at on the screen, it should be conveniently placed at the bottom of the screen where it isn't bugging anyone and won't get in the way sometimes if you are looking at a certain angle and a killer/ survivor happens to be there. The animations... take the cake by a landslide. Why do the survivors stand up like they just got yelled at for bad posture? It looks like they aren't scared when originally their stances somewhat implied tension and worry that there is a killer hunting them. You can't turn around without spending a quarter (or half, idk I didn't time it) of a second, and that is too long, by that time the killer has already lunged at you before their red stain has touched you and you've been hit. It feels like the survivors BACK hitbox has been extended by 3-5 feet depending on the killer... It's getting to the point where it is unplayable. After all of that BS I wanted to check the reviews, my mind was blown at how many positive reviews I saw. Now granted I am pretty sure it's a record high for both negative AND positive.. but I checked both of them out. The positive reviews are (mostly) from people with ~30 hours on record who have 1 review, no profile picture, roughly 5 games at max, and who say one sentence responses like "good game" or "fun to play with friends." and there are a BUNCH of those types of reviews while if you check the negative reviews... they are well thought out reviews with people that have 500+ hours. It kinda makes me think BHVR paid people to make bot accounts to balance out the negative tsunami they were expecting. I am sad that the devs went through with this update, the game was fantastic prior to this dreadful update. To everyone who read through this long review just go compare the reviews of positive and negative for yourself. It's just disappointing.
maybe fix the hitboxes but the rest is good
